Title: Romeo and Juliet
Production_Co: BHE Films, Verona Produzione, Dino de Laurentiis Cinematografica
Cast: Leonard Whiting, Olivia Hussey, John McEnery, Milo O'Shea, Pat Heywood, Robert Stephens, Michael York, Bruce Robinson, Paul Hardwick, Natasha Parry, Antonio Pierfederici, Esmeralda Ruspoli, Roberto Bisacco, Roy Holder, Keith Skinner
Plot: When the now famous "star crossed lovers" of two feuding families meet, forbidden love ensues. Shakespeare's classic tale of romance and tragedy. Two families of Verona, the Montagues and the Capulets, have been feuding with each other for years. Young Romeo Montague goes out with his friends to make trouble at a party the Capulets are hosting, but while there he spies the Capulet's daughter Juliet, and falls hopelessly in love with her. She returns his affections, but they both know that their families will never allow them to follow their hearts. Written by Jean-Marc Rocher <rocher@fiberbit.net>
Keywords: love, forbidden love, tragedy, reference to william shakespeare, male rear nudity
Actors: Leonard Whiting, Olivia Hussey, John McEnery
Writer: William Shakespeare (play), Franco Brusati (screenplay) | 2 more credits »
Description: Directed by Franco Zeffirelli.  With Leonard Whiting, Olivia Hussey, John McEnery, Milo O'Shea. When the now famous "star crossed lovers" of two feuding families meet, forbidden love ensues.
